instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041-a 5.20v
threads.message:
The LB is pretty much new and super Clean and here what i got so far:

USB-C PM = 5.20V

PPBUS_G3H = 12.26V
PPBUS_HS_CPU = 12.26V
PPBUS_HS_GPU = 12.26V
PPBUS_HS_OTH5V = 12.26V
PPBUS_HS_3V3G3H_T = 12.26V
PPBUS_HS_3V3G3HRTC_X = 12.26

PP3V3_G3H_T = 3.3V
PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X = 3.3V
PMU_ONOFF_L = 3.3V
PM_RSMRST_L = 0V
PP5V_G3S = 0V - Diode Mode =  0.402
PP1V05_S3 = 0V - Diode Mode = 0.251

threads.title: 820-01041-a 5.20v
threads.message: Did you try T2 firmware recover yet?

threads.title: 820-01041-a 5.20v
threads.message:
Nothing happen (no error or success).
The board seems dead.

threads.title: 820-01041-a 5.20v
threads.message:
Did you follow all the steps correctly???
Be aware, only one USB-C port is dedicated for recovery.
Be sure to get proper USB/Thunderbolt cable to connect both MacBooks...

threads.title: 820-01041-a 5.20v
threads.message:
After i tried a couple times, I got an error message:

The OS cannot be restored on this device.
Gave up waiting for the device transition from REstore OS state to BootedOS state.
[com.apple.MobileDevice.Mobile.Restore - 0xFA5 (4005)]

threads.title: 820-01041-a 5.20v
threads.message:
Everything works.
When you get that message, you just need update the OS and try it again.
Problem Solved.

Thank you
